node.title: A soccer game in Portugal is abandoned after Covid reduces one team to 9 players.
node.alt: Belenenses players, right, during a huddle before the match.
node.description: Players from the Belenenses team criticized sporting officials for demanding the match go on, saying soccer had “lost its heart.”
node.content: ["A top-flight soccer game in Portugal produced instead farcical drama on Saturday evening, after one of the teams was forced to field only nine players, including two goalkeepers, because the rest of its squad had been depleted by a Covid-19 outbreak.", "In the match between Benfica and Belenenses in Portugal\u2019s top professional league, Benfica\u2019s full-size complement of 11 players dominated, scoring seven goals by halftime. The game was called off during the second half, after one of seven remaining Belenenses players sat down, saying he was unable to continue, reducing his side to six. The rules of the sport require a team to field at least seven players.", "Ahead of the game, the virus swept through the Belenenses club, infecting as many as 17 of its players and staff members. One of the players who had tested positive had recently returned from playing in South Africa, where researchers were the first to identify the new Omicron variant of the coronavirus.", "The World Health Organization has labeled Omicron a \u201cvariant of concern,\u201d saying it could spread more easily than other forms of the virus. It was unclear if the player had been infected with the variant.", "The Belenenses players sought to have the game canceled, warning in a joint statement before the match that soccer would have \u201clost its heart\u201d if they were forced to play such an uncompetitive matchup amid a public health crisis. Officials reportedly told the players that the game must go on.", "Players from several other clubs criticized Portugal\u2019s sports authorities for tainting the country\u2019s reputation and that of one of its favorite sports."]
